Games.Name: Ace Avoider
Games.Overview: Avoider is an action game for an unexpanded Jupiter Ace. The idea is to control your craft (0) to intercept the Jewelites (*) while avoiding the mutant asteroids (X) which will destroy your craft on impact.  If you capture all the Jewelites, you move onto the next wave. Each wave is denser and more aggressive than the previous one.

Games.Name: Ace Invaders
Games.Overview: ACE Invaders is a side view single screen shooter where you control a spacecraft at the bottom of the screen, moving left or right, and blast various aliens that appear at the top of the screen moving downwards. You must keep blasting the aliens to prevent them from landing on the bottom of the screen and if one reaches the bottom then it is game over.

Games.Name: Ace Invasion
Games.Overview: A somewhat primitive albeit fun fixed screen shooter loosely inspired by Space Invaders for the Jupter Ace.

Games.Name: Adventure A: Planet of Death
Games.Overview:
This game is the first in Artic's Adventure series. You play the role of a spaceship pilot in the future who has been marooned on a hostile alien planet and must find his spaceship and fix it to escape. To hinder your progress are fiendish puzzles and a handful of alien NPCs .

The interface is purely text driven and there are no illustrations of the rooms that you are in. The text parser uses simple Verb/Noun for commands.

Games.Name: Alien Defender
Games.Overview: Alien Defender is a single screen shooter where the idea is to move around the screen in your spacecraft blasting as many aliens as you can trying to have more kills than the aliens. When you blast an alien your kill score increases but if you are touched then the aliens kill score increases. Before the start of the game you can select the speed from 1 - 999 with one being the fastest and as you play the speed increases. Moving off the edge of the screen makes you appear on the opposite side.

Games.Name: Amazing Maze
Games.Overview: Amazing Maze is a maze game. The maze is viewed from above and the players start out on each side of the labyrinth. The objective is then simple: to make it through the maze to the starting position. Before starting out the player has a few second to study the maze before it starts. The layout of the maze is randomly generated before a game and according to the manufacturer there are more than a million different patterns.

Games.Name: Atic Raid
Games.Overview:
You have been separated from your friends while walking on the moors when a storm appeared and now you are lost with dusk falling. You have managed to come across shelter called Haunted Hall and discovered it is empty except for all the coffins that lay around the place. The door to leave the place has disappeared so you have no choice but to explore to find another exit but entering the attic you realize you are not alone with the many rooms full of ghosts and poltergeists.

Atic Raid is an top view flick-screen arcade adventure where you must move around the 100 rooms of the attic finding objects to use like keys and transporters to get to the exit. Once you find a way out of the attic you must attempt to navigate a maze to finally find freedom. In each room is a ghost and occasionally poltergeists but boomerangs can also be found to shoot and stun them. Food is also needed to be found to stay alive and if you touch a ghost or poltergeist then you lose one of 20 lives.

Games.Name: Black Island Adventure
Games.Overview: Black Island Adventure is a text adventure over various chapters where you start your adventure in a harbour of a great city. Further investigation of the harbour, you soon realise it is deserted due to an outbreak of a plague and thus the adventure begins. The screen has text describing each location you visit and you type in commands with the keyboard to interact with each location.

Games.Name: Bomber
Games.Overview: You are the pilot of a plane that has run out of fuel and so your only option is to glide the plane down to land. Problem is the only place below is a city and so your only option is to bomb the city to remove the buildings. The game is viewed from the side on a single screen and your plane starts in the top left of the screen and moves across. When the plane reaches the right side it appears on the left but one place down. You must keep dropping bombs and if you touch a building it is game over.

Games.Name: Breakout
Games.Overview: Breakout is a recreation of the original arcade game. In the game the player moves the paddle at the bottom of the screen and has to try and keep the ball from hitting the bottom. At the top of the screen there are stones which disappear when the ball hits them. Removing stones is worth points. The higher up the stone is located, the bigger its value. The player has several lives before he or she goes game over.

Games.Name: Chess
Games.Overview: A  basic but fairly accurate for the time of release version of chess for the Jupiter Ace computer.

Games.Name: Cygnus
Games.Overview:
The deep space cargo vessel, Cygnus has been attacked by pirates from the planet Retipujeca who have killed all the crew and stolen all the cargo. As the incident was in your sector, you the leader of a Galaxy Patrol squad must board the vessel to investigate what happened on board. As the boarding hatch is damaged, and the only way to enter is with a backpack, you have also decided to go alone and to also prove your worth as a leader.

Cygnus is an arcade adventure where you must investigate three floors of the vessel, with each floor shown on the whole screen from above. You must move from room to room as quick as possible as there is only a limited supply of oxygen. Objects like keys can be found and used elsewhere on the vessel. Also on board are robots which move around the vessel and will shoot at anyone on board and if you are shot, touch a robot or run out of air, then it is game over.

Games.Name: Frogger
Games.Overview: A monochrome (black and white) clone of the popular arcade game of the same name developed by Tim Skinner and published by Boldfield Computing in1984.

Games.Name: Greedy Gobbler + Blowing Up the World
Green Cross Frog
Games.Overview: Green Cross Frog is a single screen game where you have to get a frog across the screen from left to right while avoiding the traffic that moves up or down. You can move your frog in four directions and if you touch any of the vehicles then you lose one of five lives. There is an option to play a fast or slow game.

Games.Name: Jumpman
Games.Overview: You are Jumpman and your aim in this single screen platform game is to collect all the fruit before ringing a bell on the top left of the screen. You must collect all the fruits in a certain order with the next fruit to collect shown on the bottom of the screen. There are various creatures and obstacles that need avoiding like springs, skulls and gaps in the platforms and if you touch one then you lose one of three lives. To get to higher platforms you can take a lift but can lose a life if not entered or exited correctly.

Games.Name: Meteor Racer
Games.Overview: Meteor Racer is a side view horizontal shooter where your ship is on the right of the screen and must shoot or avoid meteors that appear on the left of the screen. You can move your ship up or down and if you hit a meteor then you lose one of three lives.

Games.Name: Missile Man + Space Fighter Pilot
Games.Overview:
Missile Man + Space Fighter Pilot is a double games pack that contains the following games:

Missile Man: A single screen shooter where you control a spacecraft at the bottom of the screen, moving left or right, firing missiles upwards to blast aliens above. The aliens are in formation and move to the left and right and will drop bombs which need avoiding. One of the aliens will break from formation and fall downwards diagonally dropping bombs and if you touch a bomb or an alien then you lose one of three lives.

Space Fighter Pilot: Starting on a runway, you take-off into deep space where you have the ability to warp at two speeds looking for missiles that are being fired. As you warp through space you can select to stop and stop the missiles by controlling a sight at the top of the screen attempting to hit any missiles moving upwards. You can warp at anytime to look for more missiles.

Games.Name: Moo + Hangman
Games.Overview:
Moo + Hangman is a double games pack that contains the following games:

Moo: Based on the board game Mastermind, the idea is to guess a four digit number the computer is thinking off. Once you enter a number, the computer will tell you how many digits are correct and in the right place (Bulls) and how many are correct but in the wrong place (Cows).

Hangman: A two player game based on the pen and paper game where one player enters a word and the other player has to guess it. The player guessing enters a letter and if correct then the letter appears in the word and if it is wrong then part of a scaffold appears. After so many guesses and a picture of a scaffold appears with a hanged man, then that player has lost.
Games.Developer: P A Vickers and R A Vickers

Games.Name: Othello
Games.Overview: Othello is based on the board game where two players try to get the most counters on a 8 x 8 grid. The game starts with each player having two counters in the centre of the board diagonally from each other. Each player then proceeds to place a counter either vertical, horizontal or diagonally from one of their counters with the other players counters in between. Any counters in between then get turned to that players own colour and then it is the next players turn. The game is won when the board is full or both players can't place a counter, and the player with the most is the winner. A player can either play against the computer or another person.

Games.Name: Over Taker + Brands Hatch
Games.Overview:
Overtaker + Brands Hatch is a double game pack that contains two top view driving games. The games are:

Overtaker: The aim is to drive up a constantly scrolling road avoiding the other cars for as many points as possible before a clock counts down to zero. You move your car left or right and you can accelerate which makes the other cars appear faster but you receive more points.

Brands Hatch: The aim is to drive around a track on a single screen over five laps in the quickest time. You control your car by turning left or right but have no control over the speed. There are other cars that are static in various places on the track and if you hit them or the sides of the track this stops your car.

Games.Name: Sokoace
Games.Overview: SokoACE is a single screen top view puzzle game where the aim is to get all the boxes on to target dots over 30 maps. Each map is made up of walls and passageways and located in the passageways are a number of boxes and the same amount of target dots. You can only push the boxes, you can't pull them or push more than one box together. Once all the boxes are on the dots you move to the next map but you can move to any map at any time.

Games.Name: Tetris
Games.Overview: Tetris (Russian: , pronounced [ttrs]) is a tile-matching puzzle video game, originally designed and programmed by Russian game designer Alexey Pajitnov. It was released on June 6, 1984, while he was working for the Dorodnitsyn Computing Centre of the Academy of Science of the USSR in Moscow. He derived its name from the Greek numerical prefix tetra- (all of the game's pieces contain four segments) and tennis, Pajitnov's favorite sport.
